Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-06-13T19:00:15Describing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Leonard Sklar Ephemera Collection TAM 516
2 Linear Feet (2 boxes)
circa 1980-1990 This collection contains circulars, fliers, leaflets, newsletters, and other ephemera accumulated by Leonard Sklar, documenting a broad range of progressive/left politics in the 1980s. Materials are in English 1-2
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Kathryn Kish Sklar in 2009. The accession number associated with this gift is 2009.068.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
Printed ephemera (circulars, fliers, leaflets, newsletters, etc.) accumulated by Leonard Sklar, documenting a broad range of progressive/left politics in the 1980s, including animal rights, economic and social justice, electoral politics (including the 1988 campaign of Jesse Jackson to become the Democratic Party Presidential candidate) environmentalism, peace movements and international solidarity (Central America, Iran), radical political parties, etc.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in circa 1980-1990, are expected to enter the public domain in 2110.

Sklar, Leonard Sklar, Kathryn Kish
